intro: Lachnostachys, commonly known as the silver grass, is a genus of flowering plants in the grass family, Poaceae. It is characterized by its fine, silver-gray foliage that gives it a distinctive appearance. The plants typically grow in wet or marshy environments, making them common in temperate regions. They produce small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, which are clustered along the stems. Lachnostachys species are often used in ecological restoration projects due to their ability to stabilize soil and support wetland ecosystems.
